citation.article-title: Description of Dietzia lutea sp. nov., isolated from a desert soil in Egypt

p.s: Description of Dietzia lutea sp. nov.
Dietzia lutea (lu.te’a. L. fem. adj. lutea, orange-yellow coloured).
Cells are aerobic, Gram-positive, short rod- and coccoid-like (1.0–1.2 by 1.1–2.4 μm), non-motile, non-spore-forming and not acid-fast.
Cells show snapping division and V-forms.
Forms circular, smooth, opaque, convex, orange-yellow colonies on TSA plates.

Negative for the oxidase reaction, Voges-Proskauer and methyl red tests, production of H2S and indole, nitrate reduction, milk coagulation and peptonization, and hydrolysis of gelatin, urea, cellulose and starch.
Positive for hydrolysis of Tweens 20, 40 and 80, as well as alkaline phosphatase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase and α-glucosidase.

N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase, β-fucosidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, β-galactosidase and β-glucosidase are present, but esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cysteine arylamidase, acid phosphatase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase are absent (data from API ZYM test strips).

Utilizes l-arabinose, d-arabinose, aesculin, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, inositol, d-lyxose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, l-sorbose, l-xylose and d-xylose, but not d-adonitol, amidon, amygdalin, l-arabitol, d-arabitol, arbutin, d-cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, l-fucose, d-fucose, gentiobiose, glycogen, inulin, d-lactose, d-maltose, d-melezitose, d-melibiose, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, potassium gluconate, potassium 2-keto-gluconate, potassium 5-keto-gluconate, d-raffinose, salicin, d-sorbitol, sucrose, d-tagatose, d-trehalose, d-turanose or xylitol (data from API 50CH test strips).
Tolerates up to 15% NaCl and grows at temperatures between 10 and 45 °C, with an optimum growth temperature of 28 °C.
Grows at pH 5.0–9.0, with optimum growth at pH 7.0.
The diagnostic amino acid is meso-diaminopimelic acid, and arabinose and galactose are present in whole-cell hydrolysates.
Phospholipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol, phosphatidylinositol mannoside and phosphatidylethanolamine.
The DNA G+C content is 70.5 mol%.
The type strain, YIM 80766T (=KCTC 19232T=DSM 45074T=CCTCC AA 207008T), was isolated from a soil collected from the eastern desert of Egypt.
